Reviews.Title: “quart in a pint pot”
Reviews.Author: noshow_10
Reviews.Content: If you're sharing, do so with someone you like! Very small room with about a foot between the beds, and the smallest toilet - you could wash in the basin whilst sat on the toilet, which incidentally had the worst water pressure ever. Breakfast was just cereal, toast, fruit juice & tea/coffee, but again there was no room - tables in the doorway and that many people there it was like a game of Free Cell -one moves, everybody moves. Great location, which served its' purpose, no more

Reviews.Title: “poor quality”
Reviews.Author: Paul R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very small room, in the bathroom/toilet you could hardly move. Breakfast a bit limited. Rooms not really clean, rather dusty. View through backwindow was not pleasant (a roof with dirt on it which was thrown out of the windows. Difficult to close doors quietly, so a lot of noise from people who came and left

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fine as long as you're not a snob!”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth g
Reviews.Content: If you're planning to spend your holiday in London staying in a hotel then this is not the place for you but if, like any normal person you are intending to spend your time enjoying the joys of London then returning to a clean, brilliantly located place then this will suit you fine. I think the rating system for this hotel may be misleading as many reviewers may be comparing this to previous experiences in 5 star hotels.Admittedly this is not the smartest place on earth but it will suit those who can eat a sensible breakfast, sleep in a comfortable room and still have money in their pocket to spend on other things!

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as bad as the reviews”
Reviews.Author: looprevil
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here, i was dreading arriving at the hotel for my weekend away. First impressions from the outside was it looked neat and tidy. The receptionist was friendly, and gave us directions to where to catch the tour bus. The room was quite small, but enough to hold a double and single bed, with enough room to walk about too. Only downside was i couldn't watch the TV from the single bed. Beds were comfortable too. The beds were made for us each day and the bin emptied and towels replaced with clean dry ones. Tea and coffee were plentiful, with whitener instead of milk. Bathroom was smallish, but again there was enough room to shower and dry yourself off afterwards. The door lock took a bit of getting used to, as was remembering to leave the key at reception each time you go out. The "continental breakfast" consisted of toast and cereal, i'm not sure which continent only eat them! Not to worry, there was a Wetherspoons 5 minutes up the road towards Victoria Station.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shell456
Reviews.Content: Obviously when booking this hotel as I would never of booked it if I had! When we arrived at the hotel we could check in until 2pm so we left our luggage in the reception area where anyone could of took them luckily there was nothing valuable left! Reception area was just a taste of hat the rooms were like! We were based at the tudor inn opposite in a tiny room with 3 single beds squeezed in the bathroom was in a room no bigger than a closet! Everything was dirty shower curtain had mould didn't even want to touch the carpet it was that dirty! The beds were damp making you feel really wet! Not one thing about this room was nice! When we went over to complain the man said what do you want me to do knock the wall down and rebuild it! During tge night at 5am the people oppetsite got back and our door actually opened for them!!! They didnt come in and very quickly shut it however this could have been very different! They were very rude and couldn't care less about helping the customer! The lady on the desk however was very polite but she was only there once. I certainly would nit reccomend this hotel to anyone it's a 2 star but shouldnt even be that! No matter how cheap this hotel is nothing is worth than staying on these conditions! DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mouldy and damp”
Reviews.Author: Hazel_Freeman1985
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed here in April 2010. I have never been so dissapointed with a hotel. The room was completely damp even the bed covers were damp. The bathroom was completely green and balck with mould the shower was filthy and the shower curtain was covered in mould. I asked to switch rooms but they were full which i found very hard to believe. I had no money to stay anywhere else. I left the next morning for my holiday in Torquay, the following day i fell ill with a chest infection ! i was in bed the whole week i was there so it completely ruined my holiday. I cannot believe that they allowed the room to get this way it was disgusting i would NEVER recommend this place and im suprised it is still open. When i went to check out in the morning the guy working on the desk was asleep on the bench and another traveller was waiting to check out so i had to physically wake him myself

Reviews.Title: “the most disgusting place ive ever seen”
Reviews.Author: cauchiant
Reviews.Content: i booked 2 rooms at this so called hotel without ever thinking to read any reviews the room they gave to my daughter and her husband was in the basement and it was like tip and i had to go up 3 flights of stairs to my room which was just as bad ,my daughters room was so bad that when she had a shower the water would not drain so in started pouring into the room ,when i complained i was told what do i want from a " budget hotel" i was disgusted and how are these people allowed to get away with it the paint was flaking the carpets were filthy the beds well i would not look beyond the sheets as i didnt want to get any more shocks i had to get drunk in order to go back and sleep in that pit this "hotel" should not be open to the public and how they get a licence to run it amazes me, someones in someones pocket!.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel i have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: tonythetourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst hotel ever... DO NOT stay here. My friend had arrived before me and text to say "don't get your hopes up for a nice place".... When i arrived i made my way through the narrow corridor to my basement room next to the breakfast room. It truly was the most filthiest room ever. We put our towels on the floor to save walking on the carpet... i asked for an extra towel to shower (only to be told they do not provide extra towels). The bathroom was filthy, the walls had dirt on them, the bed was sunken in the middle so i slept only for a couple of hours. The room was noisy, the outside world felt like it was beside my pillow, the breakfast room was so loud it woke me up at 6am when they were setting up. The curtains and net curtain were black with filth...... Trust me, you can get better for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “A bit better than budget”
Reviews.Author: BigOrangeCar
Reviews.Content: Now, honestly, people should realise that you will only get what you pay for - more so than ever if you are 'budgeting' it in the centre on London. I imagine that most people writing these reviews here have not stayed in this sort of accommodation in London before - the narrow staircase, multi-level boarding house type. Being a bit of an ald hand at it now, I can honestly say that this is one of the better ones - it is clear that they have made the effort to try and make it a little more homely (decorating the halls and walkways with pictures and mirrors), and are genuinely helpful and polite, and most importantly on the ball (if you request something with one receptionist you can be sure it will have been passed on to the others). As for people complaining about having a shower / toilet in their room - be grateful! Usually in this type of accommodation you are sharing one shower and toilet with an entire level! You buy budget you get budget, but this is definitely one of the better ones. Not outstanding by any standard, but definitely a good place for a base in London.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here ... Bugs walking across the Dining Room Tables!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dduha987
Reviews.Content: This was by far the most disgusting place I've ever stayed. Room was tiny (expected by London standards) and not even remotely clean. Bed covering was stained. Ensuite room with toilet that extended halwayf into the shower - had to step up into it like a porta john. Breakfast room had BUGS crawling all over the table! I thought I was seeing things. Complained and wanted a refund for unused days, but they wouldn't refund my money. They should be shut down! It's appalling. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “A total disgrace not worth it”
Reviews.Author: craigz1987
Reviews.Content: Reception at front isnt very welcoming in appearance,Rooms very basic the view isnt very nice at the back can hear other customers talking in room next to u floor boards are very creaky so can hear every movement someone makes ,pigeons at the back are very annoying it may be a cheap option but it certainly not worth it if ur wanting a good nights sleep

Reviews.Title: “nightmare hotel”
Reviews.Author: maroggs
Reviews.Content: Worse hotel ever,smallest room and shower cubicle i have ever seen .How can they put a shower sink and toilet in a 3ft x3ft cubicle.The bedding was dirty the quilt was full of stains.They had built frames for the beds and put the smallest matteress on the frame. The towels were full of holes.I dont know how this is listed in any holiday company. It should be closed down until it was fully refurbished

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Carina55
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, they wanted us to pay extra 12£ per night, if we wanted private toilet and bath. Even though we had booked (on the internet) and paid for a room with private toilet and bath! Not good service! The room was in the basement and it was dirty and cold! Bathroom was ok.

Reviews.Title: “absolutley terrible,a complete disaster”
Reviews.Author: treezeandcol
Reviews.Content: my husband and I both in our 60's,wanted a cheap and chearful couple of nights,as we were going to see our daughter in a play.cheap it was, but certainly not cheerful.i new as soon as I saw the reception I new I had made a mistake,shabby carpets and sofas,flaking paintwork. our room no 41 ,oh my word! it was really small,and was like walking into a fridge,the reason ? the bedroom and bathroom windows had gaps approx 1inch all around,surprisingly the hotel was full so no other rooms available,I actually stuffed the gaps around the windows with toilet paper to help stop the drafts,on top of that there was no hot water,boiled the kettle to wash,curtainly could'nt take a shower,would prob have had frost bite! the only good thing was the bed sheets were spotless,which was a relief. The dinning room was far to small for the the amount of guests. do not make the mistake I made it's deffinatly worth paying extra for comfort warmth and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Even rats would turn this place down”
Reviews.Author: Kii39
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" is disgusting & personally, it shouldnt even be open to the public. The reception was small, cramped & dingy with the leather peeled of the seats in the waiting area. The man at reception informed me & my boyfriend we were to leave our key with him if we ever left the hotel, which made us slightly suspicious & we decided not to leave the key with him at any time. We finally got to our room & immediately turned into the hotel inspector. The room was cramped & filthy with dirt, mould & cracked paint everywhere. I opened the door to the "bathroom" only to find a closet with a tiolet, sink & shower in it. The sink was so close to the tiolet, you could actually wash your hands whilst on the tiolet. The back of the tiolet was black with dirt & god knows what else, the shower was disgustingly dirty. In the bedroom we found more disgusting things to take pictures of. Firstly , there were two cups & one was filthy, it looked like someone had not even bothered to wash it. The tea bags looked as if they'd being on the tray , on the desk, for decades with mould & whatnot growing on them, the hotel had the cheek to put KFC wet wipes on the tray also. On the desk there was a mirror agaisnt the wall, which was hiding none of than, live wires which were just sticking out of the wall. The bed was not comfortable at all, & one turn during the night made the most awful squeeking noise. The room was freezing at night even with the window shut & the portable radiator on. The blankets were like paper & the pillows were rock solid. The only reason we stayed at the hotel was the fact we could not leave & find another hotel as the Blair Victoria has a policy that if you leave the hotel, they still charge you for one night. Me & my boyfriend are both students & could not afford another £59 to spend on another hotel. Also the bedding was fresh & clean which was something I did not expect. I was so eager to check out the next day, that we checked out at 9:30 am instead of the 10:30am deadline, I wanted to be as far away from that place as possible. No one should endure a stay at that place, not even if they were paid. Our stay was not as horrendous as other peoples, judging by the other online reviews but charging £59 for our stay only for us not to enjoy a second of it does make my blood boil.

Reviews.Title: “Blair Victoria Hotel, dont ever go there”
Reviews.Author: tom9005
Reviews.Content: DISGUSTING This place was a dump, There was no hot water, bed was uncomfortable what a complete disgrace, The worst Hotel I've ever been too , Never, EVER again

Reviews.Title: “TO THE DEPTH OF HELL AND THANKFULLY BACK AGAIN!!”
Reviews.Author: JANSEN_G
Reviews.Content: Myself and my sister were in the dreaded BASEMENT ROOM, thankfully for 1 night hence the reason I didn't complain. It was a tip, disgusting, I still have a rash! The staff sneak in your room when you're out, I know cos i set a trap so be warned!!!!! Go to BEST WESTERN it couldn't be any worse. Oh and you hear constant noise, ie 24 hr consierge, hoovering at 6am, and paper thin walls and floor.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: kayhersey
Reviews.Content: On arriving i knew it was going to be bad as soon as i seen the reception area needed the loo so was showed where to go i gracefully declined and held it in was told we could check in at 12 when we got there it changed to 2 oclock was finally led to our room which was in the basement on the way down the dirty narrow corridors we finally arrived it was disgiusting kept my shoes on the whole time because it was so dirty couldnt swing a cat in the room the shower and toilet were disgusting so i declined to use glad i only stayed 1 night as was in need of a shower when i got home breakfast was continetal which comprised of some stale cereal and some toast on checking out asked if we could leave our bags was then told it would cost £2.50 to leave 1 bag there had no choice to leave them as was out for the day would advise anyone going to stay away and pay the extra somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “2 faced staff”
Reviews.Author: eli2012
Reviews.Content: what can i say this place is a 5 minute walk from victory and virtually opisite a load of shops including a big sainsburys, so location wise is pretty good. but thats about it. inside, when you get past the cheap flowers and decorations, the corridors and steps are about as narrow as the inside of a car, there is no room whatsoever to bring a suitcase up! they are more than happy to charge you 5 pounds for wifi access, and then when you tell them you cant get a signal, thats when they inform you that theres only signal on the first floor (i like how they are happy to sell you the wifi access though even though they know your on the 2/3/4 th floor! the manager is a charming old man so it seems, and hes all happy and smiles until he takes your anything betwen 40-90 a night depending on room, from you. then thats it, he is miserable as hell and is barely seen for the rest of the stay, and in his place at the desk are a couple of indian/pakistani? people who seem rather confused and have pretty poor english all in all, this isnt the worst hotel ive stayed in, and if your just looking for good location then this will suit you if you dont like your intelligence being insulted then stay far away

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: kiwi_NZ_67
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel by chance as we had booked into a upmarket apartment elsewhere but arrived to find the pipes were blocked and it had the most terrible smell throughout- so we walked the pavements in the Victoria area looking for another hotel. We had a look at 3 or 4 hotels but went back to the Blair Victoria for a number of reasons: -The manager Patel was extrememly warm and helpful -They went out of their way to get a room newly vacated ready for us at 9am -The room (a triple) was WAY cleaner than any of the others we had looked at in the area and was cheaper by at least 20 pounds, than surrounding equivalent hotels that we walked in to and promptly walked out of as they were dingy and dirty! -It is within easy walking distance (with suitcases) of Victoria station, shows, bus and tube routes I think it may depend on the room type and location you get as it is a long rambling property, but the triple rooms run along the 2nd floor and have large dormer windows that open with a balcony railing outside. ( we asked for this room when we returned a few weeks later) Over looking the street you can sit on your bed and watch London going past. Room size was great with a spare single bed that we used for suitcases. Patel the manager was so helpful both times we stayed in Sept and October, giving info on post offices and local barbers who wouldnt rip a tourist off in London! He didnt try and sell us anything through the hotel, but had info displayed should you want it. When I asked for a hairdryer they bought me one that was brand new in the box and the other staff offered also to carry our suitcases up the stairs for us. I would say the rooms are 'tired' as with all we saw of this type- around the 70-80 pound mark, but the rooms were spotless and cleaned daily. The curtains were old and didnt quite meet and the ceilings had a few plaster patches on them, but that we could live with. They put breakfast on for us before it was meant to open and we appreciated that- Patel also had a great sense of humour and remembered who we were "Welcome home kiwi's from New Zealand !" as soon as we returned the 2nd time, a good memory considering we had only stayed 2 days previously. Would definitely stay again, but would ensure we again had the triple rooms (there are 3) along the front of the hotel, after reading some of the other reviews on other room types. Its not flash, but it was clean and tidy wiht super friendly staff, which were the main things for us Funny thing is we choose all our accomodation overseas through trip advisor ( we were booking hotels for 2 months away so there were many) and had we had access that day to the internet, would never had stayed at this hotel looking at its rating and many of the reviews- but glad we did as we inspected it first hand and had no problems at all, so just as well we didnt review it first!!!

Reviews.Title: “This was the dirtiest and poorly-maintained hotel I have ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: VesuviusAlberta
Reviews.Content: I was shocked by the room we had booked. The carpet was so filthy and smelly, we kept our shoes on all the time. Sheets had been nailed crudely to cover up the bedheads, and the shower curtain had rusty nails holding it up!! The next night we asked for a better room, which was cleaner, but I would never grace this hotel's doorstep again. A lesson learned about budget hotels in London! We overheard 4 other parties requesting different room during our 3 night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Believe nothing of what you read”
Reviews.Author: KingaGdansk
Reviews.Content: After reading all these terrible reviews I was really shocked. I had booked the hotel earlier and I didn`t know what to do. Finally, I decided to go to the hotel but I was prepared for the worst. Fortunately, I was positively surprised. The room was quite nice, the windows were open, the bathroom was clean. The TV, fridge and hairdryer worked. We spent 4 nights there. We left the room every morning and we came back in the evening but I could notice that the room was cleaned every day. Every morning we had continental breakfast which was toasts, butter, different kinds of jam,cornflakes and tea, coffee or juice to drink. That was enough for us till lunch. For my son the breakfast was very tasty. Also the service in the hotel was very nice and the same I want to say about the manager - a very helpful man. To be honest, however, I must admit that the curtains in our room were extremely dirty. That was my first visit in London and next time I am going to stay in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “horrible and lying staff”
Reviews.Author: eric98277
Reviews.Content: i really despise this hotel room advertised at 39 i reserved it with card when i got there the evening was told 59.99 i had no other options so had to take it i was charged a fiver for wireless which upon turning on laptop did not work i came down was not granted a refund i was told there was no reception on that floor what? he should have told me before charging me a fiver pathetic shower is IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROOM nothing at all to seperate it from the room horrible horrible manky hotel avoid please

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzy85
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel we were led to an attic room which was dirty. The toilet was on a floor below and looked as if it had never been cleaned ! When we complained we were asked for £38 each night to upgrade , friends with us had also upgraded but were only charged £38 for their entire stay ( 4 nights as opposed to our 2 ),we were told we had booked ecomony ( I didnt have a choice when booking) . Breakfast for us wasnt included in the booking so we paid £14 for continental breakfast which was rice crispies, weetabix or cornflakes (self served from tuperware containers, the milk was served in jugs that had broken and chipped lips) and one toast rack of toast. The coffee was tepid. The kitchen staff were Polish and our last morning was spent listening to them argue loudly , yelling at each other between ktichen and dining room ! I am sure if the hotel (if you could call it such) was inspected it would be closed down due to serious health and safety risks !

Reviews.Title: “Do not go here!”
Reviews.Author: janeowens26
Reviews.Content: Offered a room in the attic with shower in the middle of the room, so high up we could have cleaned the chimneys! The toilet was disgusting! We 'upgraded' to a double room with a double bed an a single bed. Wardrobe had no doors, curtains needed hooks, pelmet missing, door to ensuite didn't close, expelair was ready to take off...i could go on! Lethal stairs to 'dining room'! Light fittings bare wires and staff who entertained us by yelling at each other! Fawlty Towers? Bring back Basil!

Reviews.Title: “Just be warned”
Reviews.Author: sueallan
Reviews.Content: We were booked for three nights but didnt stay for any. Room was not only small but we had to clamber over dirty linen to get to it down in the basement. The bathroom was very small and in the bedroom there was nowhere for our suitcases. The view from the only window was of the hotel refuse bins. Were offered another room at extra cost but declined. The only redeeming factor was that they refunded all but the first night. Booked on recommendation of NZ friends but obviously they got a better deal than what we were offered. Thank goodness for cell phones I say as we were able to find something far better quite easily.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to all the whiners....you get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: Jakob_Kristensen
Reviews.Content: After reading all the poor reviews on this place here, me and my travel companions were prepared for the worst. But fortunately the horrors of the hotel was nowhere to be found...We were 6 people and stayed in two rooms (quad and double), during a peak of activity in the weekend of NFL International Series @ Wembley. The quad room was rather small and a bit crowdy at times, but the overall standard was good. The double room appeared a bit larger than the quad room (strangely), and the standard here was equally good. The reception had been given wrong information regarding the number of beds in the double room, but instnatly agreed to switch rooms as soon as a new room with to single beds became available. The continental breakfast was a bit rubbish, but you can't really say you're surprised. That brings me to the overall perspective. You get what you pay for, so when the overall rate for 4 people in a quad room for three nights comes out to £255.00, and the rate for two people in a double room for two nights comes out to about £170.00, you can't really complain about the smallest of things, especially given the convinient location of the place. You should expect a clean room, which was provided to the fullest with dailly cleaning and changing of sheets. You should also expect a service-minded staff, which also was provided in full. Other than that, every other aditional service, is just a bonus!! So to sum up. the Blair Victoria isn't the best hotel in London, and not the best in the nearest surrondings either. But at a very reasonable price and with a great location, within 5-10m walk to Victoria Station, you can't really complain....and you shouldn't either.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: OZtraveller222
Reviews.Content: Two nights in Room 17 resulted in me suffering over 30 bed bug bites from neck to ankles. For 12 days I had lumps the size of 20p pieces, blisters and gnawing itches. This hotel is filthy and old. The male front office staff were helpful but the building does not offer creature comfort. Take our advice - stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Grubby”
Reviews.Author: ptrbristol
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Blair Victoria. Really is a dirty depressing, grubby little hotel. Rooms small, dirty and smelly. Refused the 1st room they showed me. 2nd not much better, but very tired so took it. Do not stay. Be warned!!!

Reviews.Title: “.......”
Reviews.Author: elizac37
Reviews.Content: * Dirty Floors * Full Trash Cans/Never emptied The bed I have to admit had fresh bedding but the shower and hand basin did not look as though it had been cleaned in months.It was the dirtiest place we have ever stayed and we really think that it should not have even 1 star never mind 3. Who said it was decent enough to be run as a hotel.? We really think this is one hotel? that needs to be removed from the listing.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: hopskipKildare
Reviews.Content: walked into the room, barely put bag down and walked back out! Brought down to basement, nearly broke our necks over sheets on stairs and then brought into pokiest, dirtiest room I've ever seen. Wouldn't put a sewer rat in it. Definitely wouldn't recommend it. Left and got a decent place nearby.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst place I have ever stayed!!!”
Reviews.Author: silverbiff
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from staying there for 4 nights. At first we were put in a tiny room in the basement, which hardly had any standing room between the bed and the walls and the view from the window was a brick wall. After complaining we were transfered to a room on the 1st floor which at least had a view of a street, but again was tiny (we couldn't even open the wardrobe doors) and the bathroom was very mouldy and none of the windows shut properly and the whole room looked like it hadn't ever been cleaned with a duster. My partner paid extra for a full english breakfast whilst I had the continental breakfast (choice of 3 cereals and that was it) After the first breakfast we didnt go again. This hotel nearly ruined our holiday and I would never recommend this place to anyone. The place looked full (mainly foreign tourists) and I felt ashamed that this would be their first image of England.

Reviews.Title: “loved the service”
Reviews.Author: bodderz
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel with great service i really dont know what people are saying . We asked for a spair pillow and they gave us one beds were made each time we came back and towels were prepared for us small but ok for sleeping in. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: raqlove
Reviews.Content: This hotel was way below standards. We were given the worst room. The toilet and the shower were attached! It smelled and was very dark. We were sent across the street, in the basement. Their ad says they have internet, it was in the main building so my children couldnt go unless I was with them, very busy street. We were promised we could move into the main building the next night for the rest of our stay, they said the rooms are much nicer and was not in the basement. I wanted a discount for the 'not nice room" for the night we stayed in it, they would give us nothing. They admitted it was not nice across the street-Tudor Inn, the name. But they sent us there anyways..no refunds nothing. Be warned this place is awful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: zappyDenmark
Reviews.Content: The worst place I've ever seen! This "hotel" is dirty and has none of the facilities they say. The room was small and unfitting for humans! Dirty and smelly. The bathroom was a plasic cabin there the water ran constantly on the floor. The room was in the basement with a window facing a 1 by 1 meter hole. The other window was in the cielling! No fireescape at all! Television: 14" with a buildin antenna which made i impossible to see anything. Just thinking about it makes my sick!

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITELY FIND SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: liscombe0
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at this Hotel - it's dirty, a fire trap and the photos are NOT WHAT IT IS REALLY LIKE!!!! BE WARNED - Find somewhere else - pay a bit more - you won't regret it! Also our room was across the road and we were asked to bring our key back each time we life - sorry, not normal practice! We didn't sleep there - found another place just around the corner!!!! Lesley from Brisbane, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but nasty”
Reviews.Author: Castlefield1
Reviews.Content: The room was small - the bathroom was a capsule where there wasn't enough room to close the door if you were on the toilet. The whole room was dirty with mould on the floor from the bathroom, windows that were falling apart and dirty bedding. I complained and they did as good as job as possible at cleaning the room but it was still bad. I made the mistake of not checking the reviews before booking and the photographs of the rooms on the webiste looked good. I appeciate this was cheap but there are much much better hotels around for the same or less money. I feel embarrased to think that people from all over the world will stay here and think this is what English hotels are like. DON'T STAY HERE! Note that the photos added to this site for this hotel make our room look 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “where not to stay”
Reviews.Author: santoleicester
Reviews.Content: poor quality hotel with safety issues/windows held open by bits of wood,sash type.location good.seemed more like a night shelter.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be described as a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tontotaylor
Reviews.Content: This really is the worse hotel we have ever stayed in. We booked for one night ( 3rd December ). The photos on their website all look very pleasing, but dont be fooled like us. We arrived at 10.00 in the morning, dropped out bag off without inspecting the room. Arrived back at the Hotel at 9.00 in the evening and was given our room key - Room 7. Well what greeted us can only be described as a total slum. Our room was Tiny, Cold, Damp, Smelly. Not to mention the filth ( looked like it had not been cleaned for some considerable time ) One pillow had blood staines !!!. Well the best bit excluding the bathroom was the state of the hair dryer. The plug at some time had over heated and burnt the wire, thus exposing live wires. When I pulled the cable the wires fell out of the plug !! After complaining we were transferred to Room 16. Slightly better but still filthy, curtain rail was hanging off, bathroom was very small and really needed a good clean. The carpets and walls were dirty as was the cups, kettle, etc. Not a very nice place to spend a night. In the morning we made our way to the restaurant for breakfast. Well you had to se it to believe it. The restaurant ( if thats what it can be called ) is down a narrow flight of stairs in the basement of thebuilding. The carpets covering the stairs, like all the others withing the hotel are thread bare and filthy. But nothing compared the the restaurant. The cups, plates, knives, forks, table cloths are discusting. The dust on the chairs was so thick you could write your name in it. Check it out if you do visit this place, look for D & A on one of the chairs !! We just turned around and walked out. After getting our bag we went to recepting to complain. Well the chap who denied he was the manager was totally rude and totally dismissed us as being fussy. My wife told him that we had taken photes of the filth around the place whic really did not go down very well with him. We were actualyy physically pushed out of the door and had it slammed behind us !! Can you believe it ?? a hotel pusing you out because you complain about the filth !! Well I went back into the hotel to voice my oponion about having a door slammed behind me and was then told by the chap ( who says he is not the manager ) that we are only complaining because we are Racist ???? Yes we are a White British Couple, and yes he is of Asian origin, but at no time was that mentioned or more to the point should he have accused us of being racist. Please anyone who is considering a stay in London, dont at any cost stay at this hotel. We have since been refunded our money via the booking company who we booked with. I just wish we had looked at the feedback from other Trip Advisors.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: BARVARA
Reviews.Content: I regret not having checked the reviews you had written before. We always go to this kind of B&B and never had seen any like this, filthy carpet, walls, toillet, shower. We had to ask for toillet rolls, towels. Tea and coffee facilities are full of limescale, tea bags are loose (anyone can caught over, touch them...) Sheets weren´t changed for 5 nights. Our first night was terrible, some guests were drinking, smoking (It is not allowed) and fighting with the stuff, after and early flight and a long day touring the city what you need is a good sleep, don´t you? Well, it was 4 o´clock in the morning and the "show" was going on. When asked about what was happening, the stuff, very rude, just told me to speak to the manager in the morning... Cleaning lady came in without knocking the door. Don´t go if you want have a good time. I had forgotten it! The building is falling down, no works have been done in the past 5 years at least, What is goig to say management about this? You cannot say I was there 3 years ago and things have changed, I saw it 2 weeks ago, November 2006. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Room Ok - Major Improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: Travelrants
Reviews.Content: The location of the Blair Victoria Hotel is perfect, with only a 5 minute walk to the Victoria Tube, bus, and train station. You step out of the hotel door into the local area, which has many shops, including restaurants and bars - so I love the hotel for the location. The reception area and stair case needs serious maintaince, with cracks in the walls, and badly needed painted walls aswell. The people at the reception desk were friendly, and let me view the room before paying. The hotel is very good for visitors who need internet access with £5 a night WiFi access that I didn't have any problems connecting to from the hotel room. The room was small, but clean, and featured storage units, wardrobe, tv, bedside cabinet and en-suite bathroom, which appeared to be recently refitted with shower, toilet and sink. The view from the hotel room wasn't appealing, overlooking over buildings in a yard, but then it is November, and its dark by 4pm in the evening, so that wasn't a problem. The major problem for me was the noise. I was next to the staircase and I could hear every whisper, and every footstep, the walls are thin so you can hear people next door if they are noisy, or have the TV up loud. The hotel appeared secure, and yes you had to leave your doorkey with the reception, but I did not find that to be a major problem. So to recap; - hotel needs major maintaince in the reception and stair case - noisy hotel if you happen to be with noisy guests - great location - okay room with cheap WiFi

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, insecure, smelly fleapit”
Reviews.Author: Kirovfan
Reviews.Content: What a disgusting place! Don't believe the photos they publish, my wife and son refussed to stay there after being shown the room. It was insecure, smelley and just plain shoddy and dirty. I spoke to the "manager" and he agreed with their comments but told me he could not refund the night they paid for as it was the booking comany's policy. Lies!!! I actually got the booking fee refunded, they told me it was the hotel who were responsible for the rest. Of course they refused when I later wrote to them. I am British and ashamed that anyone visiting England should have to stay in diabolical conditions like this, especially as it's not so cheap, there are much better places around. Take my advice folk and give this a WIDE berth and look for other places. RIP OFF merchants who deserve to be made to clean up their act before anyone stays there.

Reviews.Title: “Bnb not a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ginx
Reviews.Content: Its a BnB of the lowest standard not a Hotel .... it should not have any rating... as it was filthy and definately the worst place I ever stayed in. The room we stayed in was nothing like what is shown on their website .. misleading advertising I would call it!! The room we stayed in was disgusting... the shower had tiles falling off .. filthy bedspread ... the view from the window was of a stone wall... then a queue to get in for breakfast in the morning ... Anyone thinking of staying here .. my advise is dont.

Reviews.Title: “it wasn't as bad as the reviews say!”
Reviews.Author: elegia
Reviews.Content: I needed somewhere cheap and central to stay so I could go to a club, so I booked this hotel as a late-deal for £45 (for the room). To be honest, I'm not entirely sure this was a 'deal' so much as the going rate, but for the location I didn't mind paying my share. After booking the room I read the reviews here, and obviously I didn't have very high hopes. Our room was in the basement facing the street; the bed was under the window which I presume was single-glazed as the night got a little chilly and there was a bit of outside noise. But there was plenty of sheet layers to keep me warm, and I had quite a decent night's sleep. I imagine it could be quite chilly in winter. The room was small and basic. There was an open cupboard, tea-making facilities (although I wouldn't drink those open teabags if you paid me) and a telly. Wouldn't be very suitable for people there longer than one night as there wasn't any space for cases. Cleanliness was alright actually. The bathroom certainly did seem clean, and the shower (in a separate room to the bed!) really didn't seem so bad. The bathroom light had what seemed to be a 1watt bulb in though, so you had to use the facilities in the dark at night. The staff were fine. The reception is 24hrs, and although you have to hand your key in, there isn't a curfew. There was someone there when I trundled in at 3.30am the next day. I wouldn't necessarily go back there in a hurry, but for one night it was absolutely fine. Maybe a little below average, but you can't beat it for being a 5minute walk from Victoria. There's plenty more hotels around that area to check out before I consider The Blair Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: farley123
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is absolutely disgusting and dirty. Everywhere was fiflthty, the only clean parts were the entrance & reception, made out to decieve people. In the morning i noticed the roof in my room was leaking, and over heard other guests saying they had the same problems. They try and con you by saying that the hotel is under refurbishment written in the inroom certificate, but this is clearly a lie, as the other reviews have been bad for some time on this place. I had saw skin on arms after staying here. This place is run by Asians! They will not let you keep you're key on you, you have to hand it to reception every time you leave the building, very annoying and should not be the case with a hotel. The door to my room had a gap of about 3" underneath between the carpet and door. I would say that this Hotel is not fit to be in bussiness, and should be closed down under health and safety untill it is improved and made safe. After seeing the condition of this hotel i certainly did not risk eating breakfast here, it really put me off the idea

Reviews.Title: “The place is real bad”
Reviews.Author: sid10
Reviews.Content: Positives: white bedsheets, helpful reception staff. Negatives: everything else you can ever think of. A terrible hotel worth less than £20 for double B & B after considering convenient location in London. By the way, the Breakfast of B & B means bread and butter only.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting and a fire hazard”
Reviews.Author: colin65+
Reviews.Content: Most of the adjectives have all ready been used, but one thing that I found most disturbing was the apparent lack of fire escapes. Three floors up a narrow threadbare staircase, carrying cases, was too much for two 65+ people, and no fast way down in an emergency. Booked and paid through Hotel Club wholesale. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place!”
Reviews.Author: JK68luvtotravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1 night in 2003 with my 18-yr. old daughter & her friend. We had 2 rooms, mine was a tiny single at the top of some very narrow, steep, dark stairs(no lift, we could barely get our luggage up). The girls' room was a little larger, but they did not like it at all! It was drab & the bathroom sink would not work properly. If I had been by myself, I would have stuck it out for the 2 nights I had booked (& prepaid!), but the girls were so unhappy thatthe next day I walked down the street & found a hotel that was cheaper, nicer & friendlier (also they had a lift!). The Blair Victoria refused to refund me for the 2nd night & were very rude about it as well. By that point, I just wanted to get out of there & never see it again. We moved down the street & enjoyed our 2nd night in London in a fresh, clean hotel at a bargain rate. Avoid the Blair Victoria at all costs! There are too many decent hotels in London to put up with this!

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, dirty, windows can not be fully closed and the bathroom is not big enough for 10 years old child. When i saw the breakfast i went to eat in fastfood!!! I've also never seen so arrogant stuff. How can they call it "hotel"?!? I'll never return there. Only recommend it to your enemies.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place I've been!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brisy_Boy
Reviews.Content: I arrived late at night and that was the only reazon why I stayed for that night. I was going to be there for 2 nights and even paid for them as I made a reservation on the Internet. Looking at the website the Hotel seems to be a lot better... but in fact the place is not clean at all and seems to be falling apart. It's really terrible. The rooms are way too little, the service is not very helpful and I even asked for an invoice and didn't get one. On the next morning I tried to get a refund for the second night but I couldn't get a single pennie. I only stayed there for about 12 hours and have to say it was the most awful experience I had on an hotel, and I do travel a lot! I went to another other near by to spend my second night in London. This place should be closed down as it probably is even a danger for the public health. I've never seen a place so dirty as this one! I was really badly impressed by this. To bad I didn't check this website first as I'm looking at the rewies on this Hotel and most people have the same opinion. I had to write my own and registed especially for this so I can help others not to have a so badly experience as I had.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, wouldn't recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: Stef1ManchesterUK
Reviews.Content: We were first time tourists in London and we stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in May06 and our stay at the Blair Victoria And Tudor Inn, 78-84 Warwick Way, Victoria, London Sw1v 1rz, was the only negative memory of London. This hotel was mentioned in Ryanair's webpage and we thought that this, together with the price (298Euros for 3 nights bed and continental breakfast = about £200 for 3 nights) would guarantie a certain level for a 2 star hotel. The pictures we saw in the web couldn't be more misleading. When we got to the room we didn't have towels and we had to ask for them. Our room was dirty, with big damp patches on the walls, with the paint peeling off. The worse was that we were bitten by fleas and after searching and searching I managed to find and kill a couple of them, and they were full of blood, our blood! I like to travel a lot and I have stayed in many other hotels in different cities, some of them also 2 stars.. but I have never been bitten by fleas before and I don't think the 2 star rating should justify this hotel for it's appaling level of hygiene and basic maintenance. So no, I didn't like the hotel and I would certainly not recommend it to anyone.!!

Reviews.Title: “bad services”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I and my husband stayed 2 nights the 5-6 of May. The room was neutral, enough clean, with cheap but not bad furnitures. The dimension was proper. The toilet was poor but clean, with hot water. The problem was ouside the room. The common spaces are badly kept, there was a wall in the stairs were the water of a broken plumb fell down. There was no taste in the furnishing. Breakfast was in an ugly room at the lower level: toast, marmelade (no jam), coffe or tea, cornflakes. Not bad, but the room, the furnishing, and the crockery were bad, unfashionable and broken (but not dirty). The second day we had breakfast ouside. We will not come back in that hotel that is not cheap enough to be so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Mite-infection!!! Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One of our company got a rash over the whole body after two nights at the hotel. After visiting a doctor well home again, the doctor concluded it was mite (a small spider-insect which digs itself under your skin and lays eggs) !! The worst thing we ever have experienced in a hotel! Well, by our definition, this is NOT a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't choose this hotel! It's dirty, our double room was too small and there was just a little narrow space between the door and the bathroom. And the window was broken, so during the night we slept with not a properly pleasent fresh air in our room. The bathroom was really really small, and there was almost never hot water! so we had to have the shower with cold water even at 7 in the morning! The room were they serve breakfast it's small too,so one morning we have to be in the queue for 30 minutes to have our breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “worst place I ever stay”
Reviews.Author: albertoV05
Reviews.Content: I have stay there with my husband for a week in July 2003. We stay for the week because it was fully paid when we arrived. The room was so small, we didn,t have place for our luggages. The room and the bathroom was very dirty. There was holes in the sheet. The entire place had a unpleasant smell. I would not stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Hell at Blair Victoria”
Reviews.Author: alaskafaa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel over a year and a half ago. The experience was SO bad that once I discovered this site, I could hardly wait to warn anyone who would listen NOT to stay there at ANY COST!!! The room was small, dirty, and disgusting. I have stayed at hundreds of hotels all around the world and nothing comes close to how bad this place was. I have stayed in THIRD WORLD COUNTRIES with better accomadations. The worst part was how the management responded...they did not care. Please, do not go to this place...

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed a total of 30 minutes before checking out and finding another hotel. The rooms were freezing and felt unsafe, especially with children. We learned that you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Disgrace not a hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: irishgunner
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is an absolute joke and must be kept away from.We booked a double room with on suite and recieved a single room with a double bed and a hole that was called an en suite.When expressing our complaint the staff they were unwilling to compromise in any way even though they own another hotel just across the road called Airways. We are totally insulted that we gave them a penny. I would not even let my pet sleep in that thing. The pictures on the site are completely unrealisic and defintly not the Blair Victoria.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Blair Victoria”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: oh i had the time of my life at the Blair Victoria. As soon as we stepped through the door we were greeted by staff members who fantastic. our laugagues were taken to our rooms on arrival, we were shown the main attraction site which were nearest from the hotel. the staff member were on call 24 hours so that was very reasuring to know that someone could help us if we needed it. The best thing about this experince was the price of the rooms, all this set us back next to nothing. the rooms had everything we wanted, large and spacious. decore in the rooms were very good and didnt feel like we were in a BnB. I REALLY enjoed the experifnce. iv already booked four rooms with the Blair Victoria for this chirstmas...... i recommend the Blair Victoria to anyone and everyone..ENJOY! P.S.even though this was a 3* hotel, i really think it was 5* luxary.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever been”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't pay in advance so that you are able to go looking for another hotel after you have seen your room. I can only confirm that it was really dirty, with hairs in the toilet room and on the bed. We stayed only one day and had to find another place for the rest of our vacation in london.

Reviews.Title: “Worst I've ever seen in my life.”
Reviews.Author: Rosaadriana
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed at in my life. I'm not sure I can describe the filth adequately with words alone. The walls were cracking, the paint on the door was peelling, the carpet was so filthy it was sticky and had runs and holes in it. The toilet and shower did not work yet the shower curtain had mold all over it. The curtains on the windows were frayed and only covered two thirds of the window. The blankets on the bed were so dingy I couldn't tell if they were clean or not so I slept without any. If I had not prepaid for the room I would have left immediately. This is a great location but I'm sure there are better rooms available for the same price. I wish I had found the reviews before I booked. Most of them are right on target. Do not stay here under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is actually quite good, very near the victoria station, calm and nice neighbourhhod. Our double room however was really small, one person had to sit on the bed in order to facilitate the other to change or move around. it was really dirty and dusty, old carpets, really dirty wallpapers, bathroom small too, there were hairs left etc. So one suggestion: try to fin another hotel!!

HotelInfo.Name: Blair Victoria Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 78-84 Warwick Way, Victoria, London SW1V 1RZ, England
